text: This is interesting, Jimmy! In my experience both at a content agency and as a solo freelancer, I have found that the client is MOST successful when someone at the client company is guiding the ship/leading the content strategy. They can hire someone outside to build the strategy, do research, or write...but those outside contributors need steady guidance from inside the org. I've seen content programs really falter when the company wants to outsource everything or never spend any time thinking about their strategy. You really can't set it and forget it or "outsource content."
